# Part 1: Setup and Overview

::: {.callout-note}
## Slides Part 1
Continue with this section during **Part 1: What is R?** practice time.
:::

## About the Grit Scale

The Short Grit Scale (Grit-S) measures trait-level perseverance and passion for long-term goals. It has 8 items that form two subscales:

- **Consistency of Interest** (4 items: G1, G3, G5, G6) - measures ability to maintain interest
- **Perseverance of Effort** (4 items: G2, G4, G7, G8) - measures ability to work hard despite setbacks

**Important**: Items G1, G3, G5, and G6 are reverse-scored.

::: {.callout-note}
## Source Article

Want to learn more about the Grit Scale? [Read the original research article](https://librarysearch.gold.ac.uk/permalink/f/igqbsh/TN_cdi_informaworld_taylorfrancis_310_1080_00223890802634290) through the Goldsmiths Library.
:::

# Part 3: Reverse Scoring

::: {.callout-note}
## Slides Part 3
Complete this section during **Part 3: Reverse Scoring** practice time.
:::

## Understanding Reverse-Scored Items

Items G1, G3, G5, and G6 are reverse-scored. These items measure lack of consistency, so we reverse them to align with the other items.

For a 1-5 Likert scale, we use the formula: `reversed = 6 - original`

## Create Reversed Items

```{r}
#| label: reverse-score
#| code-annotations: above

# Reverse-score items G1, G3, G5, G6
#| 1. Apply the reverse formula to G1
grit_data$rev_G1 <- 6 - grit_data$G1
#| 2. Apply the reverse formula to G3
grit_data$rev_G3 <- 6 - grit_data$G3
#| 3. Apply the reverse formula to G5
grit_data$rev_G5 <- 6 - grit_data$G5
#| 4. Apply the reverse formula to G6
grit_data$rev_G6 <- 6 - grit_data$G6

# Verify the reversal worked correctly
head(grit_data[, c("G1", "rev_G1", "G3", "rev_G3", "G5", "rev_G5", "G6", "rev_G6")])
```

## Calculate Subscale Scores

```{r}
#| label: calculate-subscales
#| code-annotations: above

# Consistency of Interest subscale (use REVERSED versions of G1, G3, G5, G6)
#| 1. Calculate Consistency of Interest as mean of reversed G1, G3, G5, G6
grit_data$consistency_interest <- (grit_data$rev_G1 + grit_data$rev_G3 + 
                                    grit_data$rev_G5 + grit_data$rev_G6) / 4

# Perseverance of Effort subscale (forward-scored items G2, G4, G7, G8)
#| 2. Calculate Perseverance of Effort as mean of G2, G4, G7, G8
grit_data$perseverance_effort <- (grit_data$G2 + grit_data$G4 + 
                                  grit_data$G7 + grit_data$G8) / 4

# Total Grit score (average of all 8 items after reverse-scoring)
#| 3. Calculate Total Grit as mean of all 8 items (after reverse-scoring)
grit_data$total_grit <- (grit_data$rev_G1 + grit_data$rev_G3 + grit_data$rev_G5 + grit_data$rev_G6 +
                         grit_data$G2 + grit_data$G4 + grit_data$G7 + grit_data$G8) / 8

# View the new columns
head(grit_data[, c("Study_Year", "consistency_interest", "perseverance_effort", "total_grit")])
```

# Part 4: Descriptive Statistics and Visualisation

::: {.callout-note}
## Slides Part 4
Complete this section during **Part 4: Descriptives & Visualisation** practice time.
:::

## Overall Descriptives

```{r}
#| label: overall-descriptives

# Calculate overall mean, SD, and n for each scale
cat("=== Consistency of Interest ===\n")
cat("M =", round(mean(grit_data$consistency_interest, na.rm = TRUE), 2), "\n")
cat("SD =", round(sd(grit_data$consistency_interest, na.rm = TRUE), 2), "\n")
cat("n =", length(grit_data$consistency_interest), "\n\n")

cat("=== Perseverance of Effort ===\n")
cat("M =", round(mean(grit_data$perseverance_effort, na.rm = TRUE), 2), "\n")
cat("SD =", round(sd(grit_data$perseverance_effort, na.rm = TRUE), 2), "\n")
cat("n =", length(grit_data$perseverance_effort), "\n\n")

cat("=== Total Grit ===\n")
cat("M =", round(mean(grit_data$total_grit, na.rm = TRUE), 2), "\n")
cat("SD =", round(sd(grit_data$total_grit, na.rm = TRUE), 2), "\n")
cat("n =", length(grit_data$total_grit), "\n")
```

## Descriptives by Study Year

```{r}
#| label: grouped-descriptives
#| code-annotations: above

# Calculate descriptives by Study_Year
#| 1. Pipe data forward
grit_summary <- grit_data |>
  #| 2. Group by Study_Year
  group_by(Study_Year) |>
  #| 3. Calculate mean, SD, and n for each subscale and total
  summarise(
    n = n(),
    consistency_M = mean(consistency_interest, na.rm = TRUE),
    consistency_SD = sd(consistency_interest, na.rm = TRUE),
    perseverance_M = mean(perseverance_effort, na.rm = TRUE),
    perseverance_SD = sd(perseverance_effort, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_M = mean(total_grit, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_SD = sd(total_grit, na.rm = TRUE),
    #| 4. Remove grouping structure
    .groups = "drop"
  )

# Display the summary table
grit_summary
```

```{r}
#| label: formatted-table

# Create a nicely formatted table
knitr::kable(grit_summary,
             digits = 2,
             caption = "Descriptive Statistics by Study Year",
             col.names = c("Study Year", "n", "Consistency M", "Consistency SD", 
                          "Perseverance M", "Perseverance SD", "Total M", "Total SD"))
```

## Boxplots

```{r}
#| label: boxplot-consistency
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 5
#| code-annotations: above

# Create a boxplot for Consistency of Interest
#| 1. Set up plot with aesthetics (x = Study_Year, y = consistency_interest)
ggplot(grit_data, aes(x = factor(Study_Year), y = consistency_interest, fill = factor(Study_Year))) +
  #| 2. Add boxplot geometry
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.7) +
  #| 3. Customize labels and colors
  scale_x_discrete(labels = c("1" = "First Year", "2" = "Final Year")) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#9B1B30", "#2E7D32"), guide = "none") +
  #| 4. Apply minimal theme
  theme_minimal() +
  #| 5. Add informative labels
  labs(
    title = "Consistency of Interest by Study Year",
    x = "Study Year",
    y = "Consistency of Interest Score"
  )
```

```{r}
#| label: boxplot-perseverance
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 5

# Create a boxplot for Perseverance of Effort
ggplot(grit_data, aes(x = factor(Study_Year), y = perseverance_effort, fill = factor(Study_Year))) +
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.7) +
  scale_x_discrete(labels = c("1" = "First Year", "2" = "Final Year")) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#9B1B30", "#2E7D32"), guide = "none") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Perseverance of Effort by Study Year",
    x = "Study Year",
    y = "Perseverance of Effort Score"
  )
```

```{r}
#| label: boxplot-total
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 5

# Create a boxplot for Total Grit
ggplot(grit_data, aes(x = factor(Study_Year), y = total_grit, fill = factor(Study_Year))) +
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.7) +
  scale_x_discrete(labels = c("1" = "First Year", "2" = "Final Year")) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#9B1B30", "#2E7D32"), guide = "none") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Total Grit by Study Year",
    x = "Study Year",
    y = "Total Grit Score"
  )
```
